snippet: A whale population near Sri Lanka is under pressure from commercial shipping and a boom in whale-watching.
abstract: Population of blue whales off the coast of Sri Lanka, where they number in the thousands, has come under increasing pressure from commercial shipping and from a boom in unregulated whale-watching boats; scientists express concern that number of whales dying from being struck by ships is on the rise but find it difficult to confirm death tally in poorly monitored waters.
lead_paragraph: A whale population near Sri Lanka is under pressure from commercial shipping and a boom in whale-watching.

headline.seo: Traffic in Sri Lanka’s Waters Threatens Blue Whales
headline.main: Growing Ship Traffic Threatens Blue Whales
headline.print_headline: Growing Traffic in Sri Lanka’s Waters Threatens Blue Whales
